page.title: 12Siege (1) in Kings Heath
page.content: A{gunman}held armed detectives at bay in a siege in{Kings Heath}after a policewoman and a detective superintendent were shot. A man, named {James Field,}was holed-up with a shot- gun in a flat on a top floor of a house at{10 Drayton Road}. Fifty police wearing flak jackets, ringed the terraced home as a "Softly, Softly" operation was mounted to persuade the gunman to surrender peacefully. At 11.15 am.,{nine hours}after the siege started, four people, a husband and wife and another man and woman, were allowed to leave the house. Television cameras, radio and newspaper reporters were in Kings Heath all day until just after the siege ended at 3.45.
